title: Who are the top five bands of all time? - Quora

response.answer_text: Who are the top five bands of all time? That’s not as easy as you might think. Different bands are “top” for different reasons. There are the top 5 best live acts, the top 5 with the most talent, the top 5 who sold the most records, the top 5 who were most popular, the top 5 punk, the top 5 R&B, the top 5 metal, well you get the idea. That being said, I could give you MY top 5 bands of all-time…today. I say today because if you ask me again tomorrow, I would likely give you another answer. So, today, here are my pics: The Beatles: No list would ever be complete without this band. It would be like trying to paint without ever using the primary colors. The Rolling Stones: Still playing, still recording, still alive! “The Beatles wanted to hold your hand, the Stones wanted to burn your town to the ground”. Led Zeppelin: Such talent, such power, such is rock and roll The Band: With apologies to Cream, the Band is the best supergroup to ever exist. The Grateful Dead: Really? But they were a joke…and kinda ugly. Maybe so, but they defied everything that was “the norm” and turned it all on its head. Let’s let people tape our shows…for free. Let’s release an album…and rarely play any of the songs on the coming tour. Let’s sell the majority of our tickets…through a mail order that we set up. Let’s play a different show every time we perform—but your fans won’t get to see their favorite songs—they can just follow us around if they want—NOBODY will do that! But you won’t sell a lot of records?!? Well, we don’t sound that great on them anyway, we’ll just play a ton of live shows… There’s my five. My rock and roll 5 (I could do a punk 5, a funk 5, a reggae 5, etc.) I feel bad leaving out Traffic, The Allmans, Yes, The Who, Skynyrd, The Velvet Underground, ELP, The Kinks, Pink Floyd, ZZ Top, etc. but this is my list today.

Without a doubt. ..The Beatles, The Rolling Stones, Led Zeppelin, Pink Floyd, The Beach Boys and The Eagles or Black Sabbath. Can't do just 5. I mean, what about Sonny&Cher or the Osmond’s & the Jackson's, Cream, The Monkee's. They were big.. Had their own TV show. They wern't just extra's on Good Times….lol. This is an unanswerable question. I thought heard someone in the back mumble Metallica. Who said that! Show yourself!..By Grateful Who? Guess Who? Who? Jerry Lee Lewis. Now that was a bad@ss, whisky drinking, minor marring, piano playing mother f#$@er. Chuck Berry, his contribution to Rock & Roll is emense. Almost as much as Van Halen, who made the Kinks famous a second time and made doing any covers after that a crime (or should have been- remember-Dancin’ in the Streets- a crime). I'm still shuttering. Let us not forget the king. No, not Rodney, Elvis. Another partying, minor corting womanizer which reminds me of Frank Sinatra. He was smooth…you see where I'm going with this? 5? Five? It can't be done. Thanks for coming, be sure to tip your waitress..
